paragraph.heading: Introduction
paragraph.text: This document provides an overview of the key components of a bicycle. It includes descriptions and references to visual aids within a larger technical manual.

subparagraph.heading: Frame (Refer to Figure 1.1)
subparagraph.text: The bicycle frame is the main structural component, typically constructed from metal tubes welded together. It provides the foundation for all other parts.

subparagraph.heading: Wheels (Refer to Figure 1.2)
subparagraph.text: The wheels enable movement and consist of the following parts:

item.text: Hub: The central part of the wheel.
Spokes: Connect the hub to the rim.
Metal Rim: The outer circular part of the wheel.
Rubber Tire: Provides traction and cushioning.

subparagraph.heading: Seat and Seat Post (Refer to Figure 1.3)
subparagraph.text: The seat and seat post provide a comfortable riding position. The seat post inserts into the seat tube, allowing for height adjustment.

subparagraph.heading: Handlebar and Stem (Refer to Figure 1.4)
subparagraph.text: The handlebar and stem control steering and provide a mounting point for brake levers and shifters.

subparagraph.heading: Cranks (Refer to Figure 1.5)
subparagraph.text: The cranks are levers that extend from the bottom bracket to the pedals, transferring pedaling force to the drivetrain.

subparagraph.heading: Pedals (Refer to Figure 1.6)
subparagraph.text: The pedals are platforms for the feet, attaching to the cranks and receiving pedaling force.

subparagraph.heading: Chain and Gears (Refer to Figure 1.7)
subparagraph.text: The chain and gear system (drivetrain) transmit power from the pedals to the rear wheel. Key components include:

item.text: Front Chain Ring: The large gear attached to the crank.
Rear Freewheel (or Cassette): The set of gears on the rear wheel.
Front and Rear Derailleurs: Mechanisms that move the chain between gears.
Shift Lever: Controls the derailleurs.
Cables: Connect the shift lever to the derailleurs.

subparagraph.heading: Brakes (Refer to Figure 1.8)
subparagraph.text: The brake system provides stopping power and includes:

item.text: Actuators (on Handlebars): Levers operated by the rider.
Brake Cable: Transmits force from the actuator to the brakes.
Brake Calipers: Clamp onto the wheel rim or rotor.
Brake Pads: Provide friction to slow or stop the wheel.
